answers.answer: Hi!Yes, vitamin D deficiency can cause neuropathy like symptoms. Other possibilities are pinched nerves, diabetes, hypothyroidism, Lyme’s lupus, vitamin B 12 deficiencies etc. Please consult your doctor regarding this. Take care!The medical advice given should not be considered a substitute for medical care provided by a doctor who can examine you. The advice may not be completely correct for you as the doctor cannot examine you and does not know your complete medical history. Hence this reply to your post should only be considered as a guiding line and you must consult your doctor at the earliest for your medical problem.

Thank you for replying. My neuro said I have merliga parenthesis in my thighs, and feels its caused by tight jeans. This assessment took me by surprise because I have been wearing the same jeans for years. He said that the vit d deficiency could have triggered the femoral nerve to become trapped. When I asked him about the pain in my arms he said I have slight carprl tunnel, but he feels its also from low d. I can't begin to tell you how worried I have been. I have been tested for hiv probably 20 times over the last five months. I tested so many times because everytime I googled neuropathy hiv or diabetes would pop up. BTW... All my hiv tests were negative. I even had an RNA test done to confirm I was hiv negative. My A1C came back normal also. I just feel like I have been through an emotional roller coaster. I still am blow away that low d can cause neuropathy type symptoms. My emg was normal in my thighs. Anyway thanks again for confirming low vit d can cause neuropathy type symptoms.

question: About 5 months ago.I developed neuropathy in my thighs & arms. I was tested for a bunch of things and the only that was a red flag was vit d deficiency . Could vit d caused all this?
title: neuropathy
